clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) to Quantify Liver Fat in Diabetic and Pre-Diabetic Patients (0000-171)
clinical_study.official_title: Inter-Center Reproducibility Study of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) for Quantification of Hepatic Fat Fraction in Diabetic and Pre-Diabetic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the inter-center reproducibility and accuracy of hepatic fat fraction measurements using up to two MRI-based methods. The intra-class correlation coefficient (ICC) for the repeated measurements is expected to be greater than 0.6.

primary_outcome.measure: Intra-class correlation coefficient (ICC) for repeated hepatic fat fraction (HFF) measurements from the LIPOQuant method

secondary_outcome.measure: ICC for repeated HFF measurements from the 3-point Dixon method

arm_group.description: Overweight patients with or without type 2 diabetes or pre-diabetes

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be recruited for the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is able to travel to MRI centers
- All patients have a BMI â‰¥27 kg/m2 at the prestudy (screening) visit
- Patient is male or female and at least 18 years of age
- At least 5 patients have type 2 diabetes mellitus or pre-diabetes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female patient is pregnant or has a positive pregnancy test at screening;
- Patient has known liver disease other than fatty liver
- Patient has a history of neoplastic disease
- Patient is HIV positive
- Patient has known claustrophobia or other contraindication to MRI
